replies.bodyText:
Because of the heavy usage of multi-line strings I think Xtend is a better choice here.
How would you replace the Xtend multi-line strings in Java?
replies.author: miklossy

replies.bodyText:
something like Xtext2EcoreTransformerTest?

I do not know if it is a good idea to use hard-coded linux line endings as currently in the Xtext2EcoreTransformerTest.
replies.author: miklossy

replies.bodyText:
Working with fixed line delimiters is usually better than monkey-patching everything to system specific line delimiters back and forth.
We should make sure though that we do have tests for windows and unix line endings in place.

timeline.message:
[#1411] Add folding test cases to the Xtext editor (*.xtext files).

- Add XtextFoldingTest test cases based on the
org.eclipse.xtext.ui.testing.AbstractFoldingTest base class.
- Extract the XtextUiInjectorProvider from the XtextGrammarQuickfixTest
test cases into a separate class to be able to reuse that in the
XtextFoldingTest test case.

Signed-off-by: Tamas Miklossy <miklossy@itemis.de>
